doc:description.doc:para: Upload the photo @local_filename. The upload will be performed asynchronously and @opid can be used to identify the upload in the #PhotoUpload::PhotoUploadProgress signal.

There are also service-specific keys for accessing features that cannot be abstracted sufficiently. These are prefixed with "x-[service name]-" to avoid conflicts and make it clear that these have specific semantics. These are:

doc:item.doc:definition: Set's the Flickr "is_public" parameter. 1 if the photos should be publically viewable, 0 otherwise.
Set's the Flickr "is_friend" parameter. 1 if the photos should be viewable by friends, 0 otherwise.
Set's the Flickr "is_family" parameter. 1 if the photos should be viewable by family, 0 otherwise.

doc:doc.doc:summary: The local filename of the image to upload.
Operation identifier, used in the #PhotoUpload::PhotoUploadProgress signal.

doc:description.doc:para: This signal is guaranteed to be emitted at least once with either @progress at 100 (i.e. upload complete) or an error state.

doc:doc.doc:summary: Operation identifier, as returned by UploadPhoto().
Current progress, the normal range being 0 (not started) to 100 (completed), with -1 meaning an error occurred.
The human-readable error message. This will be set if @progress is -1.
